data.text: @sleepyknave You are finally figuring out this has never been about science, huh?
@mrgrimm @CDCgov I do know. Unfortunately the why of it doesn't alter the impact at the present time, in light of everything else going on.
@sleepyknave @CDCgov I assume you know this but it's b/c 11 year olds got 1/3 of the dose that 12 year olds got.

5. Map of changes with the introduction of the new CDC metrics. 

Given the context re NY, take special note of the Northeast US.

https://t.co/XDTk24Q0Av

4. Detailed description of the CDC level change graph for those who struggle with data visualizations:

https://t.co/KQ0mkXElPj

Receipts here and to follow:

1. CDC county-based risk change.

H/t @JasonSalemi

https://t.co/IPTOM87dpe

Feb 25: CDC alters risk calculations. 69.9% of new Low rated counties would be High under previous guidance.

Feb 27: NY Governor Hochul lifts the in-school mask mandate.

Feb 28: NY State releases study showing reduced efficacy in the youngest school age children. https://t.co/YGXIlHndjz
